course_name: Graduate Certificate in Applied Human Studies
overview: Students enrolled in the Master of Physiotherapy (C04306) can apply to transfer into this exit-only course after completing 24 credit points of specified study and gain a graduate certificate qualification.
awards: Graduate Certificate in Applied Human Studies (GradCertAppHumStudies)

learning_outcomes.text: Competently apply knowledge and skills to the physical assessment and management ofselected human functions across the lifespan.
Identify impairment, activity and participation limitations in humans in accordance with theInternational Classification of Function, Disability and Health framework.
Demonstrate understanding of ethical and professional behaviour and socialaccountability, utilising critical analysis and self-reflection.
Engage in critical thinking to integrate diverse knowledge and develop creative, effective and evidence-based solutions.
Communicate effectively using high level interpersonal skills.

notes: This is an exit-only course. There is no direct admission to it. Current UTS students may be able to submit an Internal Course Transfer (Graduating) application to exit with this course. See the Course transfer page for further details.
admission_requirements: None; Admission requirements for Australian students (ATAR): None; Admission requirements for Chinese students (Gaokao score out of 750): None; Admission requirements for students with GCE A Levels: None; Admission requirements for Hong Kong students (HKDSE): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (AISSC): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (ISC): None; Admission requirements for students with IB or Predicted IB: None; Admission requirements for Malaysian students (STPM with 3 AL Subjects): None; Admission requirements for Singaporean students (A Level): None; Admission requirements for USA students (SAT 1): None; Admission requirements for UTS Foundation Studies students: None
course_structure: This course comprises a total of 24 credit points.
